hello: i need help,. my system occasionally freezes and logs out itself.. where or how do i check for errors?
i need help,. my system occasionally freezes and logs out itself.. where or how do i check for errors?  (ubuntu kernel 3.2.6)
start by checking the tail of /var/log/syslog
Oct 20 03:08:00 bt kernel: [ 4260.308748] [drm] Resetting GPU - can that refer to a video card problem? i'm not sure it's installed.
that line indicates the GPU was reset at the driver level. It is often a normal event. Can you provide a pastebin of sudo tail -n 50 /var/log/syslog?
btw - i noticed it mainly happens to me when i press with the mouse on some window in the panel
There is a decent chance your problems are expressed in lines 35-39. What distribution version are you running? cat /etc/lsb-release can tell you if you aren't sure.
You should consider upgrading to at least 12.04.1. 10.04 is end of life, and video issues grow more difficult to troubleshoot as the version grows more "stale"
i'm using the bt r3 and i noticed people advised not to upgrade.
Then backtrack needs to support your issues. You are too far from mainstream to consistently support
